job_description: Business Analyst, (C2C) - job post Tech Holding Los Angeles, CA • Remote $45 - $60 an hour -  Part-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $45 - $60 an hour Job Type Part-time Contract About us: Working at Tech Holding isn't just a job, it's an opportunity to be a part of something bigger. We are a full-service consulting firm that was founded on the premise of delivering predictable outcomes and high-quality solutions to our clients. Our founders and team members have industry experience and have held senior positions in a wide variety of companies – from emerging startups to large Fortune 50 firms – and we have taken our combined experiences and developed a unique approach that is supported by the principles of deep expertise, integrity, transparency, and dependability. The Role: We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team either part-time for a 2-month or 6-month contract preferably (with potential for hire) in Los Angeles County. The successful candidate will have at least 3 years of Business Analyst experience and will be responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements, creating user stories, and work closely with stakeholders. What you will do: Facilitate meetings with stakeholders to gather input, provide updates, and ensure requirements are clearly understood. Work closely with the UX team, engineering, and QA to ensure that product requirements are met and any issues are addressed in a timely manner. Write product requirements independently and work with the team to ensure their successful implementation. Utilize JIRA Software to track progress and communicate with team members. Qualifications At least 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst. Experience gathering and documenting BRDs or creating user stories. Experience with Salesforce Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience with JIRA Software. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field. Nice to Haves: Salesforce experience Healthcare or real estate experience What we offer: Remote Work Opportunities Flexible Work Hours Professional Development Opportunities Expected Compensation $45-$60 Per Hour If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Manager, Paid Search Performance (Manager II, Business Analysis and Insights, eComm - Search Performance Manager, Walmart Connect (Marketplace Advertising Team) - job post Walmart 242,986 reviews Los Angeles, CA 90066 $97,500 - $162,500 a year -  Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $97,500 - $162,500 a year Job Type Part-time In addition to base salary, Walmart total compensation may also include bonus incentives, stock options, and more. Position Summary... What you'll do... As a Paid Search Performance Manager within the Walmart Connect Sales Organization, you will help analyze and optimize our 3rd party suppliers' search campaigns to meet their marketing objectives, drive revenue growth, and foster product improvements. You will work closely with the Sales team, Account Management, Campaign Management, and API/Ad Tech partners and be responsible for developing and implementing strategies, managing budgets and bids, optimizing account configuration, keyword targeting and reporting/insights. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the media/retail media industry and a background in the paid search landscape. This is an analytical and revenue focused role solely dedicated to the search product. Responsibilities: Plan, manage, and execute campaigns, including but not limited to account setup, strategy development, organization, and management while ensuring that recommendations and decisions are consistent with client objectives. Help 3P sellers reach their performance goals quickly and stay active/healthy. Monitor performance of Sponsored Products and drive one-to-many activities to improve performance for optimal ROI and supplier [advertiser] satisfaction. Identify domain, brand, category, and campaign trends to provide analysis to support incremental budget requests from our suppliers to grow and stabilize investment. Participate in establishing business plan objectives with Account Managers and Campaign Managers Define performance and optimization process & best practice guidelines and create robust knowledge base for internal/external use Own the relationship with our senior client stakeholders aiming for high client satisfaction and retention Reach and exceed KPIs established in partnership with suppliers, retain advertisers/revenue and reduce churn. Responsible for owning the key metrics focused towards driving exponential growth of search. Monitor account performance and ensure accurate billing and forecasting to ensure the financial health of accounts Accountable for thought leadership activity both with the client and internally, putting forward new topics of interest and championing creative strategic thinking Collaborate closely with API platform partners to act in the best interest of the client to drive performance Utilize Tableau and other internal dashboards to analyze opportunities, identify patterns and implement proactive solutions including improvements across WMC Search Platform UI, tools, and processes. Proactively identifies growth opportunities for suppliers [advertisers] search investments and proposes solutions to improve ROI. Qualifications: 3-5 years work experience in the advertising industry with focus in paid search, retail search and/or eCommerce. Bachelor's degree in Business, or related area. High level of comfort with direct client interaction, including presentations and strategic recommendations, with the ability to translate technical concepts into client-friendly language Experience in developing media strategies based on data, insights, and analytics. Strong experience in Google Ads, Bing, Yahoo!, Amazon, Co-op Advertising and all paid search terminology and key tools (e.g., AdWords, AdCenter, Retail Search, etc.). Strong analytic and quantitative skills that enable you to use data to develop, validate and measure search campaigns. Strong knowledge of keyword bidding strategies, budget cap management and optimization tactics Experience with API and Self-Serve platforms is a plus Experience developing or overseeing quantitative analysis and delivering actionable insights. Ambitious, self-starter mentality and entrepreneurial spirit with a strong drive for excellence and delivery of results. Ability to work at all levels with an eye for detail to achieve quality & process goals, actively translates Walmart's core values into everyday practices. Strong communication/interpersonal skills and able to build relationships and influence cross-functionally. Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity - unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people. At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable. For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices . Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart. Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart at https://bit.ly/3iOOb1J . The annual salary range for this position is $97,500.00-$162,500.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include: Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location) Stock equity incentives Minimum Qualifications... Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related field and 2 years' experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area OR 4 years' experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related area. Preferred Qualifications... Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. Statistical Programming Language Masters: Analytics, Masters: Business Project Management - Project Management Professional - Certification, Six Sigma - Certification Primary Location... 5404 Jandy Plc, Los Angeles, CA 90066-7006, United States of America

Sr. Business Systems Analyst - SAP MM/PP/WM/QM - job post KARL STORZ Endoscopy - America 305 reviews Santa Monica, CA 90403 Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time Company: KARL STORZ Endoscopy-America, Inc. (KSEA) Job Code: 13152 Pay Grade: US-D18 Salary Range: $95,000 - $151,500 + 15% bonus Description KARL STORZ SE & Co. KG based in Tuttlingen, Germany, is a family-owned, global company committed to benefiting humanity by advancing medical technology through innovation and education. For more than 75 years, KARL STORZ has been dedicated to earning its international reputation as a leader that designs, engineers, manufactures, and markets all its products with an emphasis on visionary design, precision craftsmanship, and clinical effectiveness. JOB SUMMARY: This is a hands-on technical position. The Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, modifying-configuring, testing, monitoring, installing changes, and all related activities for production support of our SAP ERP 6.0 EHP8 and SoH environment in MM/PP/WM/QM models. The Analyst will conduct and facilitate workshops with business partners to gather requirements for complex business processes. The Analyst will architect the solution to meet business requirements. The Analyst will perform the necessary configuration and provide functional specifications to developers to convert the requirements into a business solution. The Analyst will perform unit testing, E2E testing, and integration testing to deliver robust, scalable, and high-quality solutions in agile environment. The Analyst will transfer business process, application design, and configuration knowledge to the other team members. The Analyst will be responsible to manage Incident resolution, Change Requests completion, and small to medium project implementation in the area of procure to pay, plan to stock, and warehouse management. The Analyst will also be responsible to manage the design of the relevant master data: material master, vendor master, batch master, serial number, equipment master, etc. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Provide strong technical expertise and perform configuration in SAP Material management (MM), SAP Production Planning (PP), and SAP Warehouse Management (WM) module Perform production support for the tickets as per the SLA submitted by end users via Remedy system Propose and execute configuration changes and/or enhancements to the existing system to resolve production support issues Update the status of assigned tickets in Remedy system and inform business units accordingly on real-time basis Communicate with end-users, providing training support (as needed) and working within agreed-upon production support service level agreements for the Incidents Consult and work with all the business management and analyst stakeholders to gather requirements for solving business problems and defining new business processes Design and develop solutions in the functional area of procurement, planning, production, warehouse, and logistics for multiple companies in North America Region using the latest available SAP functionalities and best business practices Coordinate development activities with other analysts and developers Develop, document plan, and perform Unit testing, regression testing, negative testing, E2E testing, and performance testing Create and maintain the following change documentation: Process flows, Functional Specifications, Test Scripts, and Training document Train the internal IT wherever required and the Business users and management for the new SAP functionalities Remain up to date with the new releases and features of SAP by reviewing SAP release notes, periodicals, forums, OpenSAP, and technical reports Coordinate with other SAP teams and team members; like SAP different module experts, SAP Security, SAP Basis, IT Infrastructure - Hardware, Server, and Network teams, SAP ABAP developers, SAP Reporting, and Middleware Follow the SAP best practices for resolving the Incidents and deploying the Change Requests - Process analysis, Master Data analysis, Configuration and/or Development possibilities, Testing, and deploying KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: Must have at least 6-8 years of hands-on technical experience with SAP ECC with expert knowledge in SAP Material Management (MM), SAP Production Planning (PP) and SAP Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), SAP Warehouse Management (WM), SAP Inventory Management (IM) modules, and of SAP in a discrete lean manufacturing environment. Must have deep technical knowledge of configuring Purchase Requisitions, Purchase Orders, STOs, Intercompany, Release Strategy, Transfer Orders, Picking Strategy, Goods Movements, MRP, Material Master, Equipment Master, Serial Number Management and Batch Management, Purchasing Info Records, Source List, EDI/Idoc/RFC in SAP Must know integration of PP/MM/WM modules with SD, CS, and FICO modules of SAP Must have experience with at least 2 full cycle implementations in SAP PP/MM/WM/IM modules Should have experience in implementing SAP in lean manufacturing environment Must be willing to learn new SAP modules, 3rd party applications/technologies Experience in the medical device industry and in the FDA-regulated environment is desirable Knowledge and experience in implementation of SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM), S4 HANA, SAP Manufacturing Execution (ME) / Manufacturing Intelligence and Integration (MII) will be added advantage Expert knowledge of Change Management, Release Management, Agile, ASAP, and other project management methodologies Skilled in the use of the following productivity tools: MS Outlook, MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and MS Project and Visio are required Strong debugging, problem-solving, root cause analysis skills and ability to read SAP ABAP programming code Excellent English communication skills (Written, Listening, Verbal, and Presentation) with the ability to sell concepts and ideas to a diverse range of internal customers Good team player as well as a self-driven individual performer Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems Ability to balance the goals of the company while maintaining adequate controls and accurate records EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION: Bachelor's degree preferably in computer science; advanced degree preferred 6-8 years of work-related experience as an SAP Business Analyst Certified in SAP MM, PP, QM, or S/4 HANA Certification in SAP other modules, CPIM, CSCP, PMP, and Agile preferred #LI-MN1 Pay Transparency The salary range and/or hourly pay rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job posting and may be modified in the future. When determining a specific team member's base salary and/or hourly pay rate, several factors will be considered including such things as location, specialty, service line, years of relevant experience, education, professional credentials, internal equity, and the amount budgeted for the role.
